intro: Lasiosiphon madagascariensis var. baronii, commonly known as the Madagascar morning glory, is a climbing vine native to Madagascar. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue and purple. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. This variant is distinguished by its specific floral morphology and habitat preferences compared to other varieties of Lasiosiphon.
